Docs.summary: Defines methods that a type implements to serialize and deserialize an object graph.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateFormatter> interface defines methods that a type can implement to serialize and deserialize the state that an ASP.NET Web server control maintains in its <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A> property. This infrastructure is used by classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister> class to maintain an ASP.NET page's state between requests. By default, ASP.NET page state is serialized and deserialized by an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ObjectStateFormatter> class; however, site and adapter developers can implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateFormatter> interface on their own types to perform this work.
For more information about Web server control state management and view state, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce(v=vs.100)) and [Dynamic Web Server Controls and View State](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/c1ea6a66-3307-4c98-8187-cad462e1c027).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister> object that saves view and control state to a stream on the Web server. The `StreamPageStatePersister` class demonstrates how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister.Load%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister.Save%2A> methods to extract and save page state information. These methods use the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateFormatter> interface inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister> class to serialize and deserialize view state. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.PageStatePersister> class.
